node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.4.1:
node.description:
Argue that a representative

number of PP are formed at

the end of 72 hour period

node.name: Assumptions:
node.description:
1. Calibration is based on setting

the number of stromal cells (LTo)

that can express RET ligand (and

thus mediate PP development)

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.4.2
node.description:
Argue over the simulation's ability

to reproduce previously published

experimental results

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.4.2.1:
node.description:
Simulation reproduces experimental

results showing patch formation

under different conditions in

Veiga-Fernandes (2007), Luther

(2003), Eberl (2004), Meier (2007)

node.name: Note:
node.description:
This goal will be developed

in Chapter 4 of this thesis

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.4.3:
node.description:
Argue that the simulation captures

spatial characteristics of PP

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.4.3.1:
node.description:
Comparison can be drawn

between PP generated

in silico and those in vivo

node.name: Justifications:
node.description:
1. There is no quantitative data available on which

simulation PP size can be compared to in vivo

patch sizes. Thus patches are identified by eye by

collaborating experimental immunologists

2. An analysis of the patches identified by eye has

been used as a basis for what a patch is, and from

this a lower 2D area limit estimated. This shows

the prcess of determining what a patch is to be

automated (as in section 2.2.5)
